relation: Pole error: division by zero, or some other asymptotically infinite result (from finite arguments).
Inexact: the result is not exact.
Domain error: At least one of the arguments is a value for which the function is not defined.
Overflow range error: The result is too large in magnitude to be represented as a value of the return type.
Underflow range error: The result is too small in magnitude to be represented as a value of the return type.
All exceptions (selects all of the exceptions supported by the implementation).
textBeforeTable: |) into a single value: floating-point exceptions to be combined (using the bitwise OR operator: FE_UNDERFLOW is defined as a value that is an exact power of two, allowing several Whether an operation raises this exception is implementation-defined: there are no operations required to raise this exception, but an implementation may choose to do so. Operations that overflow return an unspecified value whose magnitude is no greater than the smallest normalized positive number. Underflow range errors occur when the result of an operation cannot be represented as a value of its return type because its magnitude is too small (with either positive or negative sign). underflow range errors. floating-point exception raised on int that identifies the This macro expands to a value of type Underflow range error exception int FE_UNDERFLOW <cfenv> macro googletag.cmd.push(function() { googletag.display('div-gpt-ad-1427191279638-0'); });
textAfterTable: Certain library implementations may support additional floating-point exception values (with their corresponding macros also beginning with FE_). Libraries may define in <fenv.h> only the macro values above they support (the others may not be defined). At least all of the above macro values are defined in <cfenv> (even if not supported by the implementation). See also FE_DIVBYZERO Pole error exception (macro ) FE_INEXACT Inexact result exception (macro ) FE_INVALID Invalid argument exception (macro ) FE_OVERFLOW Overflow range error exception (macro ) FE_ALL_EXCEPT All exceptions (macro ) C++ Information Tutorials Reference Articles Forum Reference C library: <cassert> (assert.h) <cctype> (ctype.h) <cerrno> (errno.h) <cfenv> (fenv.h) <cfloat> (float.h)
